alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 13 at 1:32PM CST until January 16 at 12:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Drifting Snow and Slick Travel for Some Followed by Bitter Cold... .Light snow moves back in this afternoon with gusty winds leading to some drifting across roadways, particularly across open areas of southeast Minnesota and northeast Iowa. Bitterly cold air impacts the region tonight into the start of the new week with wind chill values of 25 to 35 degrees below zero. Limit time outdoors, if possible. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow. Visibilities may briefly fall to a 1/4 of a mile or less. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...Fayette County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 PM CST this evening. For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Visit 511ia.org for road conditions.
